text: Every field of science generates data. But how does this reaches the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC)?
Here, we'll see how this is done for the catalogs of the Vizier database.
It starts with everyone publishing papers with data in it.
All the authors of peer-reviewd datasets make sure that their data is easy to reuse by using standard names, precise coordinates and extensible description
Then, either the authors submit their data themselves or the VizieR team of curators identify crutial datasets
Every table, FITS file and spectra is manually edited and verified to be sure that everything is reusable and inter-operable.
And TADA! A new dataset is viZible for everyone.
But let's zoom in the ray that reaches EOSC.
The IVOA (International Virtual Observatory Association) registry gathers the data from ViZieR, and other astronomical data centers
The datasets reach a broader audience when B2Find and the EOSC registries gather information about everything emitted by the IVOA registry.
